meanings.definition: Expressing or intending to promote a particular cause or point of view, especially a controversial one.
meanings.sent1: The article had a tendentious tone, clearly favoring one side of the argument.
meanings.sent2: Her tendentious speech only focused on supporting her own beliefs.
meanings.sent3: The tendentious cat insisted that tuna was the only acceptable food.
meanings.sent4: His tendentious painting boldly showcased his political stance.
meanings.sent5: The tendentious movie left no doubt about its message, hitting the audience hard.

meanings.definition: Biased in perspective; inclined to favor a particular point of view.
meanings.sent1: The tendentious report only highlighted the positive aspects of the project.
meanings.sent2: She always had a tendentious view when it came to discussing politics.
meanings.sent3: The tendentious weather forecast predicted sunny skies every day.
meanings.sent4: His tendentious mind saw everything through a narrow lens of opinion.
meanings.sent5: The tendentious book painted a vivid picture of the author's strong beliefs.
